Posts.Content: Hi I am due mastectomy on the 20th August and looking for information on what the dressing is like ( I believe there is one you can shower with) and how to cope with showering and when? Does anyone have ideas to keeping clean and fresh in and out of hospital. Wendy d Today is a new day 'Love it and Embrace it' Wendy d
Posts.Title: Personal freshness.

Posts.Content: AMorning all,Â  Trying to decide whether to have acrylic nails before going on holiday. Made the appointment and then googled (as we do ) and found some information regarding nail salons and Lymphodema, I have Lymphodema (15months) and wondered if anyone with this has visited nail salons?Â  Any advise please. Wendy dÂ
Posts.Title: Lymphodema and acrylic nails

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Seems a silly moan or query but I have finished chemo 6 wks ago and radiotherapy last week, during radio it was noticed I had lost half a stone in Â just over a week and still now lost a couple more pounds, I also found at the end of chemo I put weight on very quickly , its not down to eating less but I have had really bad water retention around legs and ankles, these are going down now just wondering what other Ladies have gone through with weight issues at the end of treatment. Have a nice day wendy dÂ
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi G n JÂ  At the mo slightly less than what I started off with before all this started, probably is the water as I had really bad heavy legs for a good few weeks, nothing wrong with appetite we seem to go from fretting from one thing to another Â  wendy dÂ
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Seems a silly moan or query but I have finished chemo 6 wks ago and radiotherapy last week, during radio it was noticed I had lost half a stone in Â just over a week and still now lost a couple more pounds, I also found at the end of chemo I put weight on very quickly , its not down to eating less but I have had really bad water retention around legs and ankles, these are going down now just wondering what other Ladies have gone through with weight issues at the end of treatment. Posts.Content: Hi G n JÂ  At the mo slightly less than what I started off with before all this started, probably is the water as I had really bad heavy legs for a good few weeks, nothing wrong with appetite we seem to go from fretting from one thing to another Â  wendy dÂ
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi ladies I had mastectomy 6 wks ago and about the 4th week found the bottom half below the scar line going very lumpy and hard plus increasing in growth.I Went and got it checked at a local urgent care centre one weekend and was told there it was scar tissue and not an infection etc (got checked due to going bk in for lymph node clearance 8 days ago) sos for waffling ðŸ˜„ also doesn't feel like fluid, and have had fluid removed twice. I asked the bcn when when I was in having node clearance and she could not tell me precisely what it is and was asked to wait unit Monday when drain removed from the lymph clearance ( was getting fed up by then) . On returning on the Monday to have drain removed seen another nurse who then asked a Dr to look at it who just said it nothing to be concerned about and would check again on next visit. Since Monday the area above and below scar line has grown more and feels solid underneath, i have tried before massaging bio oil around the area but was told not to put anything on by the Dr on Monday. The only way to really describe it is like the size of half an apple and the scar line being gobbled up in the middle, just wondering if anyone out there has had this problem? Wendy d
Posts.Title: Mastectomy swelling, scar tissue?

Posts.Content: Hi I had mastectomy 5 wks ago and now go back in for lymph node removal,on Wednesday , just looking for any information regarding recovery time from this as in movement, doing and driving etc. I didn't find the mastectomy to painful just uncomfortable and have just started driving again. Any information would be appreciated. Wendy d
Posts.Title: Mastectomy done, now lymph node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi LadiesÂ  Perking up a bit after a couple of bad day's on 1st Fec but looking for practical advice on how how people cope when going out etc, meals, shopping, does life have to change that much as I understand the need to be careful and not stupid but would appreciate some thoughts please. wendy dÂ
Posts.Title: Chemo advise please ?

Posts.Content: Hi Hally12 I can't really offer any reassurance but know precisely how you feel, letters should be banned from bringing news like that at the weekend. No day would be a good day! If your next appointment is this coming week then at least it's not to long to wait to see someone.Â  Just try keeping yourself busy and occupied with the children, will be easier said than done as I know a lot of ladies here knows how it feels to play the horrible waiting game.Â  Hope all goes well with your appointment and let us know how you get on. Wendy dÂ
Posts.Title: 2 years - mammogram - received letter for tests

Posts.Content: Morning allðŸ˜„ Had mastectomy 7 wks ago along with snb and that came back positive, have been in again to have full node clearance -now finally arrived at results day hurdle and that's been hard ( no good thoughts at all) looking for some positives and any list of questions I may need to ask if the results are with high nodes involved? Feel like every appointment I have had I have never had had a good result and can't see how this can be different - but here's hopingðŸ˜„ðŸ˜„ðŸ˜„ Wendy d
Posts.Title: Results day -what questions to ask?

Posts.Content: Hi Lynne Thanks for info and gives me glimmer of hope for today ðŸ˜„ ðŸ˜„ðŸ˜„ feel so alone and yuk and have held it together so far at each appointment but this one being the worst. Will ask regards path report etc At least the day has finally arrived ðŸ˜„ Glad for you on your results as I know what it's like having 2 operations and waiting again. Wendy d
Posts.Title: Results day -what questions to ask?

Posts.Content: Merry Christmas LadiesÂ  i made my my tea fairy his tea this morning as it was the first day of his Christmas break, besides i was up at the dreaded 4-45 am knitting and watching Emmerdal Â  have a good dayÂ  Wendy dÂ
Posts.Title: happy xmas eve lovely ladies !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Good Morning all ðŸ˜„ I feel a sense of relief now the day is approaching and keen to tick that one off my bus journey and progress to the next stop, , stopped worrying about the op and more worried and paranoid if it got cancelled ( mind games are so much fun) due to illness etc ha ha ! Can anyone give me information regards how they felt physically after and how you manage practically, tips on sleeping positions etc. Can you manage to go out with the drain in? Wendy d
Posts.Title: Mastectomy -1day to go

Posts.Content: LHi,Â  I was left with neuropathy in both feet and the right one being the worst. Have trouble standing for periods and really hard to try and find suitable footwear as normal sandals are a no no as I can't feel my foot underneath. Returned to work and doing a physical job and people think you can do as before as we look ok. Not good some days.Â  Did find some really good walking sandals, with good hard sole. Earth Spirit Â (Arlington) well worth the money.Â  Wendy d
Posts.Title: Peripheral Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi jmc04, I would see what the week brings and see how they are at the time you need to go. I think we can be so protective of ourselves that we panic when there is nothing you can do. Hopefully they will be out of the catching it time as its at the beginning of a cold. Use practical commen sence and use plenty of hand antibacterial gel and just remember even in hospitals, supermarkets, surgeries people of full of colds and germs.Â  Enjoy seeing them and be practical. Wendy
Posts.Title: Colds and visitors.

Posts.Content: Good morning all. 12 days have passed since left side mastectomy and going quite well not even lots of tears but did they want to come yesterday, some escaped over my roast chicken dinner my husband kindly preprairedv, think if had really started they wouldn't have stopped and just to try and hold it together with the usual words I'M ALL RIGHT - I'M FINE and of course I'm not :-) shooks!! People only see the outside and don't like to delve to deep. Awaiting this week for results from node biopsy after operation (app Thursday ) to see if I need rads or chemo) waiting is no fun :-) Hubby and family have been really good and supportive (hubby just decorated kitchen ) :-) I know I' m a lucky girl and he even going to do lounge :-) Thanks for reading Wendy d
Posts.Title: Bad Sunday ! Hoping for better Monday!

Posts.Content: Hi Sonia Thanks you made me smile and yes the bus journey carries on and like you say the unknown is worse and at least on Thursday I will know what route it is taking ( scenic would be nice with a few stops ) but way hay IT IS WHAT IT IS. I think sometimes we knock ourselves down and don' t realise how strong we are and just like the sun there has to be rain sometimes and bus sometimes gets wet. Have a nice day! Wendy d
Posts.Title: Bad Sunday ! Hoping for better Monday!

Posts.Content: Morning all, I have read on here about the taklng of tonic water for leg cramps and was just wondering if anyone had any advice on this. Been on Anastrozole for 18 months and some nights are so bad with leg pain and doesn't Â help with the lack of sleep.Â  Look forward to hearing from you for any tips.
Posts.Title: Anastrozole leg cramps and tonic water. Information please.

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Not been around for a while and been trying to get back to as normal life (if one can) I had breast cancer ,mastectomy , lymph node removal and 2 infected. Been through the chemo and rads and finally returned to work in November 2015 and still doing phased return and struggling doing 24 hours as I am left with neuropathy in my feet and also have Lymphodema and taking anastrozole tablet,causing arthritis in my knees and insomnia. Sorry to ramble on but was just trying to fill in a back ground. Now I have continuos tinnitus in my left ear and because its only on one side I have to go for a MRI scan, this could be 6-8 weeks and back to the waiting game. Still waiting for an appiontment for the ENT department also. I have been back to my GP to chase this. Obviously mind games are going into overdrive and I have convinced myself it's secondary brain Metz. Just wondering if anyone else has had any problems with tinnitus after treatment?Â  Hope everyone has a good day. Wendy hÂ
Posts.Title: Unilateral TInnitus and worried 18 months on .

Posts.Content: Thank you Dreamthief for you reply. I am still on the same brand of Anastrozole (Accord) but in February they did increase the Mirtazapine tablet to 45mg and wonder if that maybe hasÂ  anything to do with it. I will check out the other website for information. ThanksÂ  Wendy dÂ
Posts.Title: Unilateral TInnitus and worried 18 months on .

Posts.Content: Hi Morag I had mastectomy 3 wks ago and found ordinary pjs loose fitting was fine and never did wear a dressing gown as it was to to hot. It is awkward carrying round a drain and trying to keep fresh and clean but just do things in the bathroom slowly, and I found the hospital gave you a bag to put the drain bottle in at home so it's easy to carry around ( I then put it on a belt around my waist so you did not have to carry it) it's amazing how you adapt when you have to. Regarding bras these were not recommended until after the drain is out and then only a comfort bra but I found it far to uncomfortable for the first few week and have only just started wearing one occasionally or when going out. Hope all goes well for you. Wendy d
Posts.Title: trying to prepare for mastectomy
